meanings.definition: Ob: used to indicate opposition or contradiction
meanings.sent1: She wanted to go to the park, ob her brother insisted on going to the zoo.
meanings.sent2: I like ice cream, ob my sister prefers cake.
meanings.sent3: The cat wanted to play outside, ob the dog wanted to nap.
meanings.sent4: His actions spoke louder than words, ob his words were full of promises.
meanings.sent5: The sun was shining brightly, ob the clouds quickly covered it.

meanings.sent1: The car moved ob the finish line with great speed.
meanings.sent2: She leaned ob the door to listen carefully.
meanings.sent3: The students worked ob the project together.
meanings.sent4: The army marched ob the enemy's stronghold.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed ob the mountains, carrying debris with it.

meanings.definition: Ob: a slang term for an objection or complaint
meanings.sent1: He raised an ob about the unfair treatment.
meanings.sent2: She had a valid ob about the late delivery.
meanings.sent3: The customer's ob was quickly resolved by the manager.
meanings.sent4: The ob from the team led to a change in the rules.
meanings.sent5: Her ob was heard and taken into consideration by the committee.
